content.raw:
We're adding it to these functions that perform system calls on the filesystem, specifically because:

1. It's really annoying (and sometimes actually impossible) for an end-user to identify what went wrong inside of a function that is performing multiple system calls on the filesystem, so we should try to automatically provide helpful warnings, and

2. Sometimes users actually do want to do some goofy things with the filesystem and accept responsibility for parsing the errors without us intervening.

This PR has already added the option to all the APIs we offer that interact with the filesystem, so I don't think maintenance is going to be an issue.

That said, it occurs to me that a boolean is almost always a bad thing to use as a function argument because it's not very expressive, so I think I'd like to change this to an enumeration, such as

```
enum FilesystemWarningOp
{
  LOG_WARNINGS = 0,
  SUPPRESS_WARNINGS
};
```
